definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the heads of the priests and of their kinsmen in the days of Jeshua.
sentences.chinese: 这些人是耶叔亚时期中的司祭，和他们兄弟的族长。

sentences.english: He shall give orders, and they shall wash that part wherein the leprosy is, and he shall shut it up other seven days.
sentences.chinese: 司祭当吩咐人将带有斑痕的物品洗涤，再收藏七天。

sentences.english: After the blood of the guilty was shed, the Lord said to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron, the priest.
sentences.chinese: 上主对梅瑟和大司祭亚郎的儿子厄肋阿匝尔说。

sentences.english: With the Scion , I now have the means to create anything I desire.
sentences.chinese: 有了司祭盎，我现在能创造任何我想要的东西。

sentences.english: Phinees our father, by being fervent in the zeal of God, received the covenant of an everlasting priesthood.
sentences.chinese: 我们的祖先丕乃哈斯因为热诚，才获永为司祭的盟约。

sentences.english: Yours are going to cost you both pieces of the Scion.
sentences.chinese: 你要付出的代价就是两片司祭盎。

sentences.english: All the cities together of the children of Aaron the priest, were thirteen, with their suburbs.
sentences.chinese: 亚郎的子孙司祭们共分得了十三座城和所属城郊。

sentences.english: The towns of the priests, the descendants of Aaron, were thirteen towns in all, with their pasture lands.
sentences.chinese: 亚郎的子孙司祭们共分得了十三座城和所属城郊。

sentences.english: And when he was accused by the chief priests and ancients, he answered nothing.
sentences.chinese: 当司祭长和长老控告他时，他什么也不回答。

sentences.english: And king Demetrius confirmed him in the high priesthood.
sentences.chinese: 为此，德默特琉王也委任他为大司祭。

sentences.english: And for them shall be the firstfruits of the firstfruits of the land holy of holies, by the border of the Levites.
sentences.chinese: 属司祭的地是献地中至圣之地，靠近肋未人的边界。

sentences.english: And apprehending him, they led him to the high priest's house.
sentences.chinese: 他们既拿住耶稣，就带著解到大司祭的住宅。

sentences.english: You both spent years searching for the Scion of Atlantics.
sentences.chinese: 你们花了多年的时光寻找亚特兰蒂斯的司祭盎。

sentences.english: The priest that is anointed shall carry of the blood into the tabernacle of the testimony.
sentences.chinese: 然后受傅的司祭取些牛血带进会幕。

sentences.english: But this, for that he continueth for ever, hath an everlasting priesthood.
sentences.chinese: 但是耶稣因永远长存，具有不可消逝的司祭品位。

sentences.english: They also sent copies of these letters to the High Priest Simon.
sentences.chinese: 他们还将这信给息孟大司祭抄写了一份。

definition: feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Protestant)/also called 聖事|圣事 by Catholics
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
